words: Susie bpen moor lae bpen ajarn
glosses: Susie COP doctor and COP teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.

words: Susie bpen moor lae ajarn
glosses: Susie COP doctor and teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.

words: Susie bpen moor gub bpen ajarn
glosses: Susie COP doctor and COP teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.
comment: “gub” is normally translated as “with”/ ”together”

words: Susie bpen moor gub ajarn
glosses: Susie COP doctor and teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.
comment: “gub” is normally translated as “with”/ ”together”; with the second one you wouldn’t use a copular

words: Paul kalang doo TV lae leed ser-paa yuu
glosses: Paul CONT watch TV and iron shirts CONT
translation: Paul is watching TV and he is ironing his shirts.

words: Paul kalang doo TV gub leed ser-paa yuu
glosses: Paul CONT watch TV and iron shirts CONT
translation: Paul is watching TV and he is ironing his shirts.
comment: “gub” is normally translated as “with”/ ”together”

words: Susie bpen moor dae khao mai mee dang
glosses: Susie COP doctor but 3.SG NEG have money
translation: Susie is a doctor but she is poor.
comment: Yaang rai gor dam - “however”; more formal alternative, could replace “dae” in the same position

words: Jen ser aidim dae khao ser hai kon-blaek-naa
glosses: Jen buy ice-cream but 3.SG buy give stranger
translation: Jen bought ice cream but she bought it for a stranger.

words: Paul mai bpen moor dae panak-ngarn-dorn-lap
glosses: Paul NEG COP doctor but receptionist
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.

words: Paul mai dai bpen moor dae panak-ngarn-dorn-lap
glosses: Paul NEG MOD COP doctor but receptionist
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.

words: Paul mai bpen moor dae khao bpen panak-ngarn-dorn-lap
glosses: Paul NEG COP doctor but 3.SG COP receptionist
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.

words: Paul mai dai bpen moor dae khao bpen panak-ngarn-dorn-lap
glosses: Paul NEG MOD COP doctor but 3.SG COP receptionist
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.

words: Jen mai ser aidim dae ser chocolate
glosses: Jen NEG buy ice-cream but buy chocolate
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream but she bought chocolate.
comment: you can’t omit the verb ( ser ) in this context

words: Jen mai dai ser aidim dae ser chocolate
glosses: Jen NEG MOD buy ice-cream but buy chocolate
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream but she bought chocolate.
comment: you can’t omit the verb ( ser ) in this context

words: Jen mai ser aidim dae khao ser chocolate
glosses: Jen NEG buy ice-cream but 3.SG buy chocolate
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream but she bought chocolate.

words: Jen mai dai ser aidim dae khao ser chocolate
glosses: Jen NEG MOD buy ice-cream but 3.SG buy chocolate
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream but she bought chocolate.

words: Kam-dorb ker A rue B
glosses: answer COP A or B
translation: (Either) the answer to the question is A or the answer to the question is B.

words: Kam-dorb ker A rue kam-dorb ker B
glosses: answer COP A or answer COP B
translation: (Either) the answer to the question is A or the answer to the question is B.

words: Kam-dorb ker A mai gor B
glosses: Answer COP a NEG also B
translation: (Either) the answer to the question is A or the answer to the question is B.

words: Kam-dorb ker A mai gor kam-dorb ker B
glosses: Answer COP a NEG also answer COP B
translation: (Either) the answer to the question is A or the answer to the question is B.

words: Paul bpen moor rue John bpen moor
glosses: Paul COP doctor or John COP doctor
translation: (Either) Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.

words: Paul bpen moor mai gor John bpen moor
glosses: Paul COP doctor NEG also John COP doctor
translation: (Either) Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.

words: Chan luerm tolosap tii ngarn rue tam lon dorn gub baan
glosses: 1.SG forgot phone LOC work or do drop when return home
translation: I left my phone at work or I dropped it on my way home.

words: Chan luerm tolosap tii ngarn mai gor tam lon dorn gub baan
glosses: 1.SG forgot phone LOC work NEG also do drop when return home
translation: I left my phone at work or I dropped it on my way home.

words: John bpen moor rue pukien
glosses: John cop doctor or writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.

words: John bpen moor rue khao bpen pukien
glosses: John cop doctor or 3.SG cop writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.

words: John bpen moor mai gor pukien
glosses: John cop doctor NEG also writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.

words: John bpen moor mai gor khao bpen pukien
glosses: John cop doctor NEG also 3.SG cop writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.

words: John bpen moor rue pukien aat tang-soong-an
glosses: John cop doctor or writer maybe both
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer (maybe both).
comment: “mai gor” not possible in this context

words: John bpen moor rue khao bpen pukien aat tang-soong-an
glosses: John cop doctor or 3.SG cop writer maybe both
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer (maybe both).
comment: “mai gor” not possible in this context

words: Khun luem tolasap tii ngarn rue bon lod may
glosses: 2.SG forget phone LOC work or on car bus
translation: Did you leave your phone at work or did you leave it on the bus?
comment: you can’t use “mai gor” in questions like this (but see Q2); interrogative just marked by intonation

words: Khun luem tolasap tii ngarn rue khun luem bon lod may
glosses: 2.SG forget phone LOC work or 2.SG forget on car bus
translation: Did you leave your phone at work or did you leave it on the bus?
comment: you can’t use “mai gor” in questions like this (but see Q2); interrogative just marked by intonation

words: Laan A ca kay yiihor ni rue Laan B
glosses: Shop A MOD sell brand DET or shop B
translation: Would Shop A sell this brand or would Shop B sell this brand?

words: Laan A ca kay yiihor ni rue Laan B ca kay yihor ni
glosses: Shop A MOD sell brand DET or shop B MOD sell brand DET
translation: Would Shop A sell this brand or would Shop B sell this brand?

words: Paul mai chai moor lae mai chai payabaan
glosses: Paul NEG COP doctor and NEG COP nurse
translation: Paul is neither a doctor nor is he a nurse.

words: Mike mai ser aidem lae mai hai nong-sao
glosses: Mike NEG buy ice-cream and NEG give younger.sister
translation: Mike didn’t buy ice cream nor did he give it to his sister.

words: Mike mai dai ser aidem lae mai hai nong-sao
glosses: Mike NEG MOD buy ice-cream and NEG give younger.sister
translation: Mike didn’t buy ice cream nor did he give it to his sister.

words: Mike mai ser aidem lae khao mai hai nong-sao
glosses: Mike NEG buy ice-cream and 3.SG NEG give younger.sister
translation: Mike didn’t buy ice cream nor did he give it to his sister.

words: Mike mai dai ser aidem lae khao mai hai nong-sao
glosses: Mike NEG MOD buy ice-cream and 3.SG NEG give younger.sister
translation: Mike didn’t buy ice cream nor did he give it to his sister.

words: Paul luaek gin cupcake dai rue luek gin cookie dai
glosses: Paul choose eat cupcake MOD or choose eat cookie MOD
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or he can eat a cookie.

words: Paul luaek gin cupcake dai mai gor luek gin cookie dai
glosses: Paul choose eat cupcake MOD NEG also choose eat cookie MOD
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or he can eat a cookie.

words: Susie mai chai moor lae mai chai nak-wing
glosses: Susie NEG COP doctor and NEG COP runner
translation: Susie isn’t a doctor or a runner.
comment: can’t use “or”-morphemes here

words: Susie bpen moor , bpen ajarn
glosses: Susie COP doctor , COP teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.
comment: this needs a connective

words: Susie bpen moor , ajarn
glosses: Susie COP doctor , teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.
comment: this needs a connective

words: Susie bpen moor lea bpen ajarn
glosses: Susie COP doctor and COP teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.

words: Susie bpen moor lea ajarn
glosses: Susie COP doctor and teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.

words: Paul kalang doo TV leed ser-paa yuu
glosses: Paul CONT watch TV iron shirts CONT
translation: Paul is watching TV and he is ironing his shirts.
comment: needs a conjunction

words: Susie bpen moor khao mai mee dang
glosses: Susie COP doctor 3.SG NEG have money
translation: Susie is a doctor but she is poor.
comment: ok, that’s fine (with the pronoun “khao”), but feels a bit like two sentences

words: Jen ser aidim , khao ser hai kon-blaek-naa
glosses: Jen buy ice-cream , 3.SG buy give stranger
translation: Jen bought an ice-cream, she gave it to a sad-looking person.
comment: ok, that works (“Jen bought an ice-cream, she gave it to a sad-looking person.”)

words: Paul mai bpen moor khao bpen panak-ngarn-dorn-lap
glosses: Paul NEG COP doctor 3.SG COP receptionist
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.
comment: ok, but “khao bpen” (pronoun + copular) is mandatory

words: Paul mai dai bpen moor khao bpen panak-ngarn-dorn-lap
glosses: Paul NEG MOD COP doctor 3.SG COP receptionist
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.
comment: ok, but “khao bpen” (pronoun + copular) is mandatory

words: Jen mai ser aidim khao ser chocolate
glosses: Jen NEG buy ice-cream 3.SG buy chocolate
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream but she bought chocolate.
comment: ok, that works (with the pronoun “khao”)

words: Jen mai dai ser aidim khao ser chocolate
glosses: Jen NEG MOD buy ice-cream 3.SG buy chocolate
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream but she bought chocolate.
comment: ok, that works (with the pronoun “khao”)

words: Paul bpen moor , John bpen moor
glosses: Paul COP doctor , John COP doctor
translation: (Either) Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.

words: Paul bpen moor rue John bpen moor aat tang-soong-an
glosses: Paul COP doctor or John COP doctor maybe both
translation: Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor (maybe both).

words: Paul bpen moor mai gor John bpen moor aat tang-soong-an
glosses: Paul COP doctor NEG also John COP doctor maybe both
translation: Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor (maybe both).

words: Chan luerm tolosap tii ngarn , tam lon dorn gub baan
glosses: 1.SG forgot phone LOC work , do drop when/while return home
translation: I left my phone at work or I dropped it on my way home.
comment: ok if it means sth. like “I forgot it at work whilst going home/ exiting the building”

words: John bpen moor khao bpen pukien
glosses: John COP doctor 3.SG COP writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.

words: Khun luem tolasap tii ngarn mai gor bon lod may
glosses: 2.SG forget phone LOC work NEG also on car bus
translation: Did you leave your phone at work or did you leave it on the bus?
comment: Both ok, also as an alternative question

words: Khun luem tolasap tii ngarn mai gor khun luem bon lod may
glosses: 2.SG forget phone LOC work NEG also 2.SG forget on car bus
translation: Did you leave your phone at work or did you leave it on the bus?
comment: Both ok, also as an alternative question

words: Paul mai chai moor mai chai payabaan
glosses: Paul NEG COP doctor NEG COP nurse
translation: Paul is neither a doctor nor is he a nurse.
comment: unacceptability might have something to do with the copular
